title: Explore Words
mainDescription: SayRight is your AI-powered companion for mastering English word pronunciation. Browse thousands of words with IPA transcriptions, native audio, categories, and difficulty levels. Sign up to record your pronunciation and receive intelligent feedback with improvement tips. Track your progress by saving words you've mastered or need more practice with. Ready to speak clearly and confidently? Let‚Äôs get started!
practiceHint: Record yourself and compare with the native pronunciation above.

supportBanner.message: üí° This website is powered by my time, creativity, and some AI magic ‚Äî which all come with a cost. If you enjoy it or find it useful, you can support my work by buying me a coffee. ‚òï

ipa.title: Learn IPA Symbols: Videos + Guide
ipa.intro: I prepared two videos to help you understand how to pronounce the symbols used in phonetic transcription (IPA). One is about consonants, the other about vowels and diphthongs.
ipa.subtitleNote: Since I may speak a bit fast, I recommend turning on English subtitles. They're auto-generated, but they usually capture what I say quite well.
ipa.extraNote: I sometimes use Polish or Spanish words mid-sentence, which might slightly confuse the subtitles. Nothing serious, but now you know!
ipa.subtitlesText: Click the ‚öôÔ∏è (Settings) icon on the video, choose 'Subtitles', and pick English (auto-generated).

about.title: About Me
about.paragraph1: Hi! I‚Äôm Anna Heliasz ‚Äî an English teacher turned full-stack developer with a passion for language, logic, and learning.
about.paragraph2: I hold a Bachelor‚Äôs and a Master‚Äôs degree in English Philology, with specializations in teaching and in language, culture, and literature. I've been teaching since 2017, helping hundreds of students in Poland and Spain master the mysteries of English grammar ‚Äî and survive it with a smile!
about.paragraph3: In 2023, I discovered a new love: programming. I dove headfirst into HTML and CSS, graduated from The Bridge bootcamp in Full Stack Web Development, and continued exploring JavaScript, React, Node.js, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, and TypeScript. And now? I‚Äôm building cool things, like this very app!
about.paragraph4: Outside of code and classrooms, I‚Äôm curious about AI, SEO, and how to make complex ideas feel simple. This site is a little piece of me ‚Äî hope it helps you learn and maybe even makes you smile!

patterns.title: Common Pronunciation Patterns
patterns.intro: English spelling and pronunciation can be confusing. Below are common combinations that can help you decode how words are typically pronounced.
patterns.soundTitle: Letter Combinations with a Specific Sound

silentCombos.example: walk, folk ‚Äî l is often silent

cautionCombos.warning: Many pronunciations: tough, though, through, etc.

patterns.closingNote: Did you know? In Polish, 'character' is pronounced with 'h', in Spanish with 'k' ‚Äî in English, it's 'k' because of its Greek origin!
